title: Keith Duffy reveals he can't remember Boyzone's heyday as he was so DRUNK
text:
He has had a successful music career with Boyzone for over 25 years, selling millions of records, touring the world and bagging numerous awards.

However, Keith Duffy can no longer remember much of the band's heyday as he was too drunk, after partying hard at the height of their success.

And the singer, 45, has revealed that he's in no mood to slow down as he declared: 'I don’t want to want to grow up.'

Forgotten: Keith Duffy can no longer remember much of Boyzone's heyday as he was too drunk, after partying hard at the height of their success

Speaking to Daily Star, Keith explained that he partied so hard that much of his time in the band is a blur.

He said: 'I can't remember any of the early years. I watch videos of the old days and it's the first time I've seen it. Jack Daniel's has a lot to answer for.'

But despite being married with two children, the hunk revealed that he hasn't changed his ways and still enjoys that lifestyle to this day.

He continued: 'Am I better behaved now? No. I don’t want to want to grow up. I’ve met some old people and they’re feckin’ boring. I want to have some fun. I don’t know how Ronan gets up at 4am to do his radio show. I’m not even home at that time.'

Party hard: And the singer, 45, [pictured with Boyzone] has revealed that he's in no mood to slow down as he declared: 'I don’t want to want to grow up'

The No Matter What hitmaker went on to say that he's banned from discussing what the boys got up to in their younger years.

'I’m not allowed to talk about what went on,' he stated. 'What happens on the road, stays on the road. If smartphones had been around when we first started, we’d be in prison.'

Keith, alongside Ronan Keating, Stephen Gately, Mikey Graham and Shane Lynch, formed Boyzone in 1993.

However, they've now split after 26 years of success, with the band playing their final gig at the London Palladium on Friday.

Hazy: I can't remember any of the early years. I watch videos of the old days and it's the first time I've seen it. Jack Daniel's has a lot to answer for'

No slowing down: 'Am I better behaved now? No. I don’t want to want to grow up. I’ve met some old people and they’re feckin’ boring. I want to have some fun'

Earlier this month, Keith and Ronan paid tribute to their late band mate Stephen, who sadly paased away from natural causes 10 years ago.

Ronan, 42, took to Instagram Stories to share a collection of throwback pictures of Stephen, who died aged 33 at his holiday home in Port D'Andratx, Majorca, on October 10 2009.

The When You Say Nothing at All singer started his montage with a grey background, which simply said 10 on it, and he ended the emotional tribute with a photo of himself and Stephen. He captioned it: 'Miss ya bro x.'

Back in the day: What happens on the road, stays on the road. If smartphones had been around when we first started, we’d be in prison' [pictured in 1996]

While Keith Keith shared a throwback picture of himself with Stephen on stage, he penned: 'Chance made us Colleagues Love and laughter and fun made us best friends!

'I miss you brother 10 years ago today the good lord deemed you to good for this world, He needed an angel in heaven!

'Today I celebrate and reminisce all the fun and laughter ups and downs I love you Steo and I pray you continue to look over me ❤️see you down the road Stephanie Xxxx All my love Kitty xxx.'

Stephen died from natural causes at his holiday home in Port D'Andratx, Majorca, on October 10, 2009, leaving fans around the world devastated.

Heartbreaking: Ronan, 42, took to Instagram Stories to share a collection of throwback pictures of Stephen, who died aged 33 at his holiday home in Port D'Andratx, Majorca
description: Keith Duffy, 45, revealed he can no longer remember much of the band's heyday as he was too drunk, after partying hard at the height of their success.
